page.title: 09Farming-Broughton/Holt
page.content: The land in this area is good agricultural land with little waste-land. Of the sixteen farms in the area only Common Farm and Lower Farm are dairy farms, the remainder produce beef, maize, corn and oil seed rape. Less hay is produced than in the past as silage is now the main cattle fodder. The profit margin in all aspects of farming and greater efficiency ie round baling of grass, has led to fewer men being employed on the land, helping to reduce production costs. ATTITUDES ON FARMING Concern is expressed in the farming community that even with greater efficiency, overproduction in the EEC threatens the future of farming in Britain, reducing the numbers employed on the land and the demise of rural communities such as this.
